intro: Cracca amoena, commonly known as the red hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Cracca amoena is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
